So the @EnvAgency has published its annual report, 5 months late.

Apparently they "Have achieved a huge amount over the last year", obviously including, not a single river in England reaches 'Good' overall environmental health.

Spent ¬£1.431 billion and employed 10,229 staff. https://t.co/0aEhhtaw8p

urls.title: Community engagement on Tenbury Wells flood risk management scheme
urls.description: People in Tenbury Wells have until 31 January 2021 to visit a virtual engagement room to find out about a proposed flood risk management scheme.

tweets.text:
Reminder to residents & business owners in #TenburyWells - visit our online engagement room before the end of Jan & find out about your flood risk management scheme

Two facilitated phone calls arranged for 26 & 28 January for those without internet access https://t.co/GY8WvQgmob

urls.title: Planners give green light to Otter Valley project
urls.description: A project to help a river valley adapt to climate change and create an internationally important wildlife reserve now has planning permission.

tweets.text:
Our plan to restore the floodplain of the lower River Otter on England‚Äôs Jurassic Coast has been approved by @eastdevon.

Work will start soon to help the valley adapt to climate change and create an internationally important wildlife reserve.

Read more: https://t.co/IrOjgPdF1f

tweets.text:
Quagga mussels are an invasive non-native species and have recently been found in the #RiverTrent.

They can spread rapidly and block pipes.

Help us prevent this: check, clean and dry your equipment and footwear after spending time around watercourses. 
https://t.co/yvjXsvp14v https://t.co/xuYv9GXUrF

tweets.text: @EnvAgencyAnglia Whilst this is a lovely story, your water resources department have let @AffinityWater drain the upper Ivel completely dry for months this year. A dry river is a dead river. How about a whole catchment approach to looking after the Ivel?  @IvelRev @AquiferChalk @OliverHealdUK

These 2 planters @CarshaltonHigh might look the same, but they have 2 different water storing methods inside ‚Äì gravel and geocellular crates! Together with the students we‚Äôll be measuring how they work and how we can stop more rain from rushing to the drain. #SuDSnotFloods https://t.co/g7KASeL9ty

tweets.text: @BillBullick @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency I am not sure that is actually the problem. I suspect that all resources are focussed on flood prevention, which is important, but not the sole remit of the agency.

Would be great if you could help us promote a whole range of KS1 and KS2 educational resources we have on our website.

@GosportCouncil @FarehamBC @ChichesterDC @WaterUK @CCWvoice @Ofwat @EnvAgency @EBPSouth @educationgovuk @portsmouthtoday @portsmouthnews @Chiobserver https://t.co/fj5vjkp21v

tweets.text: @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency In the private sector, people who get results are paid. Those that don't become unemployed. The EA appears to be a typical public sector quango. The culture is toxic and needs to change. Accountability is sorely lacking.

This is a huge result for #ClimateAdaptation. The River Otter has been trying to reconnect with its flood plain since 1812. This is partnered with a similar project in the Sa√¢ne Valley in France. If successful the model will be rolled out further. #RacetoResilience #adaptourworld https://t.co/LWKN3wdVG6

@DefraGovUK @TonyJuniper @NaturalEngland @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @williamrworsley @ForestryEngland With the Governments planned 17000 homes being built in between 2 SSSI sites in Thanet on grade 1 farmland, resulting in NO remaining internal land for migratory birds such as the Golden Plover,or skylarks, lapwing, bunting, you are off to a very bad start.
